column4: someone was talking ftp servers, anybody familiar with proftpd? I have a question...
yep, i've done proftpd server, etc. what's up?

I hardly ever use ftp, but have to now.  I installed proftp, but having trouble making it go.  /etc/init.d/proftp reports that it must be started from inetd or xinetd.  Have made the appropriate file in xinet.d but its not going yet, what now?
also im offsite using ssh, not onboard with a gui desktop
on the private chat...
you around? i'm not getting any messages.
im here
lag beguiles the man, computers befumble him
haha, what?
just trying to get through...
bah, this system is messed. i hate windows.
Im actually using ubuntu strangely enough!
ORLY??
how about that proftpd then?
what was the question again?
he he, I installed proftpd, put an xinetd file in and can't figure out how to start it!  Maybe I'm stupid after all
you can't start the xinetd file?
no, I've kind of forgotten, its been years since I played with xinetd
i don't even remember what xinetd files are? man, i'm so rusty.
its ok, philH just got me going in standalone
okay, good. sorry i can't help you too much here.
thanks anyway, you cant help everyone -
